item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Now and then I’m spending a few minutes on this, and I’ve gotten it to do the following:

Connect (no shit)
Disconnect (rly)
“Parse” messages from others into a better format: Widu #loltest :hi
Output raw input (obviously)
Send messages, although you have to put it into the source before executing it. I’ll add a run time listener thingy (whatever you call it, I forgot) now.

AND, LAST BUT NOT LEAST: I ADDED COMMENTS THAT AREN’T NEEDED BECAUSE THE CODE SPEAKS FOR ITSELF: “disconnect disconnects from the server”

Source:

/*
 * Usage:
 * Connect
 * send PASS, USER, NICK, MODE, JOIN 
 */

import java.net.Socket;
import java.io.*;

public class ripIRC {
	
	BufferedWriter out = null;
	BufferedReader in = null;
	Socket ircSocket = null;
	
/*
 * The send method sends a message to the Writer
 */
	public void send(String... toWrite) throws IOException{
		for(String write : toWrite){
			out.write(write);
			out.flush();
		}
	}

/*
 * The read method reads the input from the BufferedReader, and prints it to the console
 */
	public String read() throws IOException{
		String input = in.readLine();
		return input;
	}

/*
 * disconnect disconnects from the server
 */	
	public void disconnect() throws IOException{
		ircSocket.close();
	}

/*
 * The connect method connects to the given server, via the given port
 * It also initializes the BufferedWriter and BufferedReader
 */	
	public void connect(String ircServer, int ircPort){
		try{
			ircSocket = new Socket(ircServer, ircPort);
			out = new BufferedWriter(new OutputStreamWriter(ircSocket.getOutputStream()));
			in = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(ircSocket.getInputStream()));
			
		} catch(IOException l){
			System.out.println("Error " + l);
		}
		
	}

/*
 * This method prints the normal messages from IRC
 */	
	public void normalMessageIRC() throws IOException{
		String input = read();
		
		if (input.contains("PRIVMSG")){
			int x = input.indexOf("PRIVMSG") + 7;
			int y = input.indexOf("!");
			String output = input.substring(x, input.length());
			String msgSender = input.substring(1, y);
			System.out.println(msgSender + output);
		}
	}

/*
 * This method prints the raw input from IRC
 */	
	public void rawMessage() throws IOException{
		System.out.println(read());
	}
}

Usage:

import java.io.*;

public class Main {
	
	public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException{
		ripIRC ripIRC = new ripIRC();
		String server = "";
		String usern = "";
		String password = "";
		String channel = "";
		int port = 6667;
		
		ripIRC.connect(server, port);
		
		ripIRC.send("PASS " + password + "\r\n");
		ripIRC.send("USER " + usern + " 8 * :" + usern + "\r\n");
		ripIRC.send("NICK " + usern + "\r\n");
		ripIRC.send("MODE " + usern +  " :+i\n");
		ripIRC.send("JOIN " + channel + "\r\n");
		while(true){
			ripIRC.normalMessageIRC();
		}
	}
}

I know it’s shit, but I’m still a beginner. So please, give some constructive criticism.
